column4: Is there an equivalent of Acronis TrueImage for ubuntu?  I've heard good things about clonezilla and dd_rescue, but I'm looking for something with compression, scheduling, and incremental backup capabilities.  Does this exist?
partimage is cool for backups too.
look in software center for backup. There are many I believe.
Im not sure many of them have ext4 support yet.
aah good point. it's still pretty new
I simple drag and drop of your home folder to an external drive is so easy to do.
yeah, i do like the idea of byte-for-byte backup though
byet for byte is what dd does and it is very unefficient use of space unless you pipe it to gzip etc.
If grid gets updated with screen edge optiosn then the keystrokes are the only option at the moment.
Your probably not gonna get a byte for byte incremental backup solution cause the file system has to be unmounted. So not possible.
i realize that linux is not windows, but doesn't acronis do byte-for-byte on a mounted filesystem?
Apples to Oranges
Why would you want to backup empty sectors anyways?
well i don't.  I really just want to back up the entire system. config files, apps, data, etc...
Back In Time is mentioned by Robby Ferguson on category5.tv and its supposed to look for new files on the system and back em up for you. Check that out.
that sounds very interesting actually
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qrsBgfz9xDk
Compiz plugin named Grid does just that with simple numpad keystrokes.
but it's keystrokes only?  i guess that's better than nothing
CTRL+ALT+numpad4 will switch the window to left side of screen and goes between 1/2, 1/3 of screen etc.
hmm no numpad though
set your own keystrokes.
I use that plugin all of the time when multitasking instead of manually resizing all my windows to see them all.
BTW Im sure the grid plugin does much more than win7 does. It can split the screen in 1/4, 1/3, 1/2.
